Articles.Content:
Hi guys, i was Just wondering, whats you favorite place to visit? Because of the limit of 10 choices in the poll, just vote for the system that is your favorite, and if you like one of its moons, say that in a post. (Hoping this poll works:)) Personally, even though I've been to a few other planets and moons, i still love Minmus the most. So, what's YOUR favorite place to visit?(If it is a specific area you can say that too) By the way, Jool system includes all of it's moons except for Laythe.

Edit: got the poll working

Edited November 25, 2013 by Mr.Rocket

Laythe/Jool primarily.

Landing a SSTO space plane on Laythe is one of the best feelings to me, as well as seeing the Jool-rise
Petty much Duna for me because I always get the feeling I'm on Mars and I love Mars. I just wish there was something like Valles Marineris on Duna, the canyons we have are pooly made.
I like going to the moon... it's the easiest to maintain realism, but I can do things that our governments won't!

I love going to Eeloo. It's so desolate, so far from the sun, and it just seems, as the an Apollo astronaut famously said, "magnificent desolation". Plus, it's the smallest body you can sprint on, so it's fun to sprint then jump and faceplant in the ice.

Duna, it's far enough away to be a challenge but doesn't require the crazy amount of delta v required to get to and around like the Joolian system (even though it is infinitely more interesting the Duna and Ike)

Edited November 25, 2013 by FlamedSteak
Minmus, Mun, Duna and Jool in no particular order. Minmus is awesome for its low gravity, the Mun looks just awesome. Duna... ah, the pyramid and the face. Jool is just cool

I feel like Moho, partly because it's such a challenge to get there, so you feel so great when you land, and partly because no other place in the Kerbol system quite captures the feeling of 'beautiful desolation' like it.

<iframe width="100%" height="550" class="imgur-album" src="http://imgur.com/a/RaDUw/embed" frameBorder="0" abp="1144"></iframe>

I feel like Moho, partly because it's such a challenge to get there, so you feel so great when you land, and partly because no other place in the Kerbol system quite captures the feeling of 'beautiful desolation' like it.

^This. Duna is a very close second for me "because Mars".
Duna for me.. Easy to reach, has just enough atmosphere for parachutes/aerobrake, perfect gravity for rovers and easy to get back from due to thin atmosphere and lowish gravity.
Mun, because the craters give you such a big workout, there's such a wealth of amazing scenery, and it can be tricky landing. Also because you can be minimalism.

Mun or Eeloo.

Something about them is just so awesome.

I had to go with the Kerbin System (and specifically Minmus), simply because I haven't gotten anywhere else yet.

That said, I do enjoy me some Minmus. Funky color, and so little gravity I once killed a Kerbal by jumping too high while running downhill (no jetpack necessary on that one).
I still think my favorite is all the way out at the newest planet, simply because it's such a pain to get there, so the satisfaction of actually doing it is truly something.

I like Duna.

Close enough to easily get to with minimunim dV, atmosphere (So parachutes can guide your landing), and not hilly as the moon.

I built a base on Duna. I've never successfully recovered a Kerbal from the Mun.

I'm not sure. I've sent out five manned expeditions to the moon, all whom ended in failure. That's a loss of 15 kerbalnauts. I have yet to lose one on Duna. I have no idea why, but I cannot, for the life of me, brake anything with a engine without a parachute to guide me.
Duna. I've only ever been there once, with a Curiosity ripoff workalike. It's pretty.

I cannot, for the life of me, brake anything with a engine without a parachute to guide me.

Try this video:

You'll never even blink at a Mun landing again.
My favorite thing to do is build gargantuan ships and probes that leave the Kerbol system forever.
No love for Eve? I go there all the time, but never to land.
Duna is awesome, lots of Easter eggs on Duna and Ike, also its a great place to build a base at mild difficulty

Laythe is amazing, and the Jool system in general. Low Laythe orbit makes a great staging point for Joolean adventures. The moons are great fun to navigate. It's why i'm surprised more players are not clamoring for more gas giants.

After hating on Moho for so long I do finally get why people do like it. It is rather desolate and a bit creepy. In a polar orbit, zipping across the surface in orbit at low altitude, with the huge Sun on horizon, it's epic.
I like going to mun, I go there just for fun, I have a base, It has docking ports, And I'm sending tourists from Kerbin
There is something awe inspiring about standing on Ike and watching Duna oscillate above.
I love the Jool system, its SOI is so big it's not that hard to get to, and it's great fun just to slingshot about the place. Plus you get some awesome views, like this one
It's gotta be the Jool system. It's so beautiful. Then again, everything is beautiful in KSP. (Ok, maybe not everything)
